lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He noted that under the new Financial Services Act, Britain could revoke or deny licences to Japanese banking and insurance institutions in London if U.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Tensions have risen following the decision by Britain to arm itself early with new statutory powers which it says could be used against certain Japanese financial insitutions.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Asked whether the letter from Nakasone was a rejection of attempts by Britain to achieve that, Howard said "I am not sure it is correct to regard Mr Nakasone's letter as a rejection of Mrs Thatcher's request of him - and it says he is taking a personal interest in this problem."
